posts.name: Dr.G
posts.cooked: How can I set the deadbanding for the SparkMax controller with a brushless motor attached using Java code?

posts.name: Dr.G
posts.cooked:
Interesting code.

Is this for setting overall soft limits on a SparkMAX-controlled motor or is it for deadbanding?

Seems that this code is useful for limiting, for example, the left and right rotations of a turret.
shoot your right this is soft limits not sure why my brain defualted to soft limits
are you using a joystick for this? if so in the code where you get the joystick inputs just do an if like this:
does not look like the spark maxes have any built in way to do deadbands

posts.name: Max Morehead
posts.cooked: You can use the WPILib function MathUtil.applyDeadband .

posts.name: Dr.G
posts.cooked:
Thanks - we can do that (as we did in the past). My reason for asking is that there is a deadband function for the falcon motors - thought that a similar function existed for SparkMAX and that I just couldn’t find it. Code, such as what you provided, was always a fallback position.

Appreciate the insights - and the insights into spft limits. I wonder, is there similar soft limit handling for the SparkMAX? (We are likely to have both hardware limit switches and soft limits - one to back up the other.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked: SparkMax hard and soft limits work for us but there is no neutral dead zone except for the PWM interface.
